items.title: Danish PM calls for strong answer from EU leaders to Russia's hybrid attacks
bullets: • Danish PM calls for strong answer from EU leaders to Russia's hybrid attacks
• Danish PM Mette Frederiksen: "From a European perspective there is only one country
• willing to threaten us and that is Russia" The incursions have become most acute for countries on the EU's eastern flank

items.title: Private payrolls declined in September by 32,000 in key ADP report coming amid shutdown data blackout
bullets: • Private payrolls dropped 32,000 jobs in September, the biggest drop since March 2023
• The report comes as the government shutdown continues
• The Bureau of Labor Statistics' payrolls report for September will not be released, nor will the Labor Department put out the weekly jobless claims count on Thursday

items.title: US government shutdown live: first closure since 2018 begins after funding bill fails
bullets: • US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
• Hundreds of thousands of federal workers stood to be furloughed or laid off
• President Donald Trump said he had 'no choice' but to lay off federal workers
• Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer said Republicans were trying to ‘bully’ Democrats

items.title: Mortgage refinance demand plunges 21%, as interest rates hit 3-week high
bullets: • Applications to refinance a home loan fell 21% for the week and were 16% higher than the same week one year ago
• The drop was mostly driven by a pullback in refinancing
• The average contract interest rate for 30-year fixed-rate mortgages increased to 6.46% from 6.34%

items.title: Jobs, travel, national parks - what impact will US shutdown have?
bullets: • Federal workers will not receive any pay cheques while the shutdown continues
• Air traffic control and law enforcement officers will continue to work through the shutdown
• Americans planning to travel abroad could also be affected by delays
• The shutdown is set to continue through October and beyond

items.title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
bullets: • The shutdown is the first since a 35-day closure that began in December 2018 and extended into the new year
• It comes as Democrats look to regain their footing with voters, who re-elected Trump last year and relegated them to the minority in both chambers of Congress

items.title: Peloton revamps equipment, launches commercial unit and raises prices ahead of holidays
bullets: • Peloton is relaunching its product assortment, introducing a commercial equipment line and raising prices for both subscriptions and hardware
• The revamped assortment includes better audio, processors and WiFi across all of its machines
• Its refreshed plus line will feature an AI-powered tracking camera, speakers and a 360-degree swivel screen

items.title: Miami deal for Trump library next to famous Freedom Tower angers critics
bullets: • State of Florida votes to donate land for Donald Trump's presidential library
• Critics say it is a betrayal of Miami's famous El Refugio, a beacon of hope for immigrants
• Florida's Republican governor and three cabinet members voted unanimously on Tuesday

items.title: Golden retriever boyfriends and ick lists: gen Z’s dating rules are making them ‘constantly disappointed’
bullets: • Lea Veloso, 26, has an ever-growing ick list on her Notes app that she references whenever she starts seeing someone new
• It’s an ick if he doesn’t call his parents, sniffs every five seconds, is an unsuccessful DJ or is embarrassed to do karaoke
• “I think I’m constantly disappointed by real men.”

items.title: Bowen: Momentum is the strength of Trump's Gaza plan, but lack of detail is its weakness
bullets: • Donald Trump has made himself into a leader to whom it is hard to say no, says Bowen
• He says Hamas has 'three to four days' to decide whether to say yes or no to end the Gaza war
• Bowen: Momentum is the strength of Trump's Gaza plan, but lack of detail is its weakness

items.title: Ford CEO Jim Farley eyes further improvements after five years of ‘surprises,’ including investor returns
bullets: • Ford Motor CEO Jim Farley marks his fifth anniversary as CEO on Wednesday
• Farley has been working to make Ford more capital efficient, improve quality and grow profit margins
• He's optimistic about Ford continuing to improve overall performance and grow shareholder value
• "I think there were certainly a lot of surprises," he says

items.title: In their own words: The Artemis II crew on the frenetic first hours of their flight
bullets: • Astronaut Jeremy Hansen: "There's enough time built in there to have a nap
• I’ve been practicing falling asleep
• So if the loops are quiet enough, and I get a minute, I'll try for a nap" The Artemis II mission is NASA's first Moon mission in more than 50 years

items.title: First Thing: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
bullets: • The US government shut down on Wednesday, after Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding unless they were granted concessions on healthcare
• The GOP, which controls the Senate and the House of Representatives, refused their demands, and the Senate failed to advance both parties’ bills to keep funding going past midnight

items.title: CNBC's Financial Advisor 100: Best financial advisors, top firms for 2025 ranked
bullets: • CNBC created CNBC's Financial Advisor 100 in 2019 to recognize the country's best financial advisors and top financial advisory firms
• For 2025, the process began with 40,563 registered investment advisor firms, or RIAs, and that list was reduced to 1,015 that met CNBC's requirements

items.title: South African firebrand MP Malema convicted of firing a gun in public
bullets: • Julius Malema found guilty of unlawful possession of a firearm and firing it in public
• The charges carry a minimum sentence of 15 years in prison
• Malema was convicted of hate speech less than two months ago
• He often lashes out at the white minority in a country where racial tensions still run high

items.title: State of calamity in Philippines province as earthquake kills 69
bullets: • At least 69 people have been killed and dozens injured after a powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the Philippines on Tuesday
• The province of Cebu, which suffered the brunt of the damage, declared a state of calamity early on Wednesday
• Thousands spent the night on the streets amid repeated aftershocks

items.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where you might stumble across Zelenskyy taking a stroll
bullets: • The Maidan, Kyiv's Independence Square, has been the heart of political change in Ukraine for more than two decades
• In 2004, a cop climbed on stage, knelt, and kissed the flag; a decade later, riot police snipers opened fire on demonstrators carrying wooden shields and European Union flags

items.title: Where things stand with Trump's National Guard deployments
bullets: • The Trump administration has deployed or threatened to deploy National Guard troops in more than half a dozen American cities that it says are crime-ridden
• The announcements have led to protests, lawsuits and, in certain cases, open arms
• With so many cities, agencies and legal challenges in the mix, we break down where everything stands with deployments

items.title: What happens now that the government has shut down. And, a pricing deal with Pfizer
bullets: • Government shutdown begins after Senate unable to reach agreement on two competing funding bills
• Some ethics experts say that could violate the Hatch Act, which is intended to keep politics out of government work
• The last government shutdown lasted 35 days and was the longest in U.S
• history

items.title: Government shutdown could delay key economic reports at an especially sensitive time
bullets: • Government shutdown could delay key economic reports at an especially sensitive time for the economy
• A key report on the job market will not be published on Friday, as scheduled, as a result of the government shutdown
• That means businesses and policymakers will be left guessing about the strength of the labor market at a time when the economy appears to be slowing

items.title: Rep. Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., talks about the government shutdown
bullets: • Rep
• Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., talks about the government shutdown
• NPR speaks with him about the shutdown
• Listen to the full transcript of this week's episode of Morning Edition on NPR's "This Morning Edition" at 7 p.m
• ET

items.title: Kimmel and Colbert appear as guests on each other's shows
bullets: • Jimmy Kimmel and Stephen Colbert appear as guests on each other's shows Tuesday night
• Kimmel's show was suspended temporarily on Sept
• 7 after his monologue was "ill-timed and insensitive" Colbert's show is on CBS and Kimmel's ABC show on ABC

items.title: A GOP push to restrict voting by overseas U.S. citizens continues before 2026 midterms
bullets: • Some 2.8 million U.S
• adult citizens living abroad were eligible to vote in 2022
• GOP officials are pushing to block voting by citizens who've never lived in the United States
• Advocates fear GOP-led lawsuits and proposals could drive down participation of overseas voters

items.title: Federal agencies are rehiring workers and spending more after DOGE's push to cut
bullets: • DOGE has failed to deliver on its promises to cut costs and increase efficiency, NPR finds
• Agencies ordered to drastically slash their workforces are now hiring back hundreds of workers
• The bulk of that spending goes to debt service, national defense, and entitlement programs

items.title: Scientists may be closing in on dark matter’s true identity
bullets: • Scientists may be closing in on dark matter’s true identity
• LUX-ZEPLIN is rewriting the rules in the epic quest to uncover dark matter
• The world's most sensitive dark matter detector, LZ (LZ) hunts for dark matter from a cavern nearly one mile underground in South Dakota

items.title: Scientists just found the strongest signs of life on Mars yet
bullets: • Scientists just found the strongest signs of life on Mars yet
• The presence of iron-phosphate and iron-sulfide nodules suggests processes resembling microbial activity on Earth
• Scientists caution that only Earth-based labs can confirm their true origin

items.title: Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world
bullets: • Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world 40 light years away
• Early data suggests hints of an atmosphere, but much remains uncertain
• Researchers have already ruled out a hydrogen-rich primordial atmosphere, pointing to the possibility of a secondary atmosphere that could sustain oceans or ice

items.title: The AI slop drops right from the top, as Trump posts vulgar deepfake of opponents
bullets: • AI poses an obvious danger to the millennia-long human fight to find the truth
• Large language model "hallucinations" and vocal deepfakes have had a blurring effect on facts
• The danger is perhaps most acute in the political realm, where deepfake audio and video can make any politician say or appear to do anything

items.title: In 2022, the world axed a disease name seen as racist. US just switched back.
bullets: • The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has reverted from using the disease name "mpox" to the obsolete "monkeypox" The name came about because scientists discovered the virus in captive Asian monkeys that had been shipped to Denmark in 1958
• The term "monkey" has a long history of being used as a slur toward Black people

items.title: Alexa’s survival hinges on you buying more expensive Amazon devices
bullets: • Amazon unveils new Alexa+ devices at its Devices event in New York City
• Amazon's Alexa+ is supposed to be more conversational and more powerful than the original voice assistant
• The new devices are supposed to have the power to make Alexa+ as successful as possible

items.title: Critics slam OpenAI’s parental controls while users rage, “Treat us like adults”
bullets: • Parents sued OpenAI over claims ChatGPT acted as a "suicide coach" for 16-year-old Adam Raine
• The lawsuit was filed by parents, Matthew and Maria Raine, alleging that "ChatGPT killed my son" OpenAI says it has been consistently rolling out safety updates since the lawsuit
• The lead attorney for the Raine family says some of the changes come "far too late"

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: Scientists just solved Uranus’ coldest mystery
bullets: • For decades, Uranus baffled scientists because it seemed to have no internal heat
• New computer modeling shows the planet actually emits more energy than it receives from the Sun
• This subtle warmth suggests Uranus’ story is more complex than previously thought, offering fresh clues about its violent past

items.title: A plant compound might be the secret weapon against gum disease
bullets: • Morin-based powder, extracted from guava leaves, apple peel, and figs, can be slowly released with the help of polymers and serve as an alternative to antibiotics
• This could replace antibiotics, avoid side effects from existing treatments, and help vulnerable patients maintain oral health

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Ray-Ban Meta Gen 2 review: all-day smart glasses with the same tricky questions
bullets: • The second-generation Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses aren’t too different from the first
• The biggest change is that they have a better battery life, making them easier to rely on as a private set of speakers or an eye-level camera for an all-day adventure
• The glasses were fully charged when I put them on right before 9AM PT

items.title: Oura adds colorful ceramic rings and charging case to lineup
bullets: • Oura adds colorful ceramic rings and charging case to lineup of smart rings
• The company is also introducing health panels for blood work, a recycling program, and multi-ring device support
• The ceramic rings start at $499, and will come in four colors: midnight, petal, tide, and cloud

items.title: OpenAI made a TikTok for deepfakes, and it’s getting hard to tell what’s real
bullets: • OpenAI announced its new AI video- and audio-generation system, Sora 2, on Tuesday
• It's being released as a way for consumers to play around with a new AI tool
• It includes a social media app with the ability to create realistic videos of real people saying real things

items.title: Allowing more tailpipe pollution means higher fuel costs for Americans
bullets: • Americans will pay more at the pump if Donald Trump succeeds in tossing out tailpipe pollution regulations, a new analysis shows
• That’s on top of job and GDP losses that could result from stifling innovation in cleaner transportation
• Trump has misleadingly cast the climate pollution standards as an “EV mandate” that would force consumers to buy more costly electric cars

items.title: Keychron made the first almost entirely ceramic keyboard
bullets: • The Q16 HE 8K is the “first-to-market full-ceramic build keyboard,” says Keychron
• The ceramic material is described as durable, scratch-resistant, and suitable for reliability
• It comes in a 65 percent layout and comes in blue or minty white color options
